<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">never lived-- there were still nobles and gentry who</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">many other things."</quote> So <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wcax" key="Caxton, William">Caxton</rs> printed the old dream.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It has a childs love of particularity. Txxxxxxxx Everything</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is stated. The beauty is in the statement, not in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">suggestion. <quote source="#" rend="inline">"So he went in and searched from chamber to</quote></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>chamber, and found his bed, but she was not there; then Balin</l>
            <l>looked into a little garden, and under a laurel tree</l>
            <l>he saw her lie upon a quilt of green samite and a knight with</l></quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">makes us see?</l>
